Yoga is an excellent way to reduce stress, boost energy, and improve overall well-being. As a beginner, it's essential to start with a gentle and accessible routine that you can modify to suit your needs. Here's a simple and gentle yoga routine for beginners:

**Warm-Up (5-10 minutes)**

1. **Mountain Pose (Tadasana)**: Stand with your feet hip-width apart, arms by your sides, and engage your core. Feel grounded and relaxed.
2. **Neck Stretch**: Slowly tilt your head to the right, bringing your ear towards your shoulder. Hold for 30 seconds and then switch sides.
3. **Shoulder Rolls**: Roll your shoulders forward and backward in a circular motion. Repeat for 30 seconds.

**Sequence 1: Foundational Poses (10-15 minutes)**

1. **Downward-Facing Dog (Adho Mukha Svanasana)**: Start on all fours. Walk your hands forward, lift your hips, and straighten your arms and legs. Keep your palms and heels grounded. Hold for 30 seconds.
2. **Cobra Pose (Bhujangasana)**: Lie on your stomach with your hands under your shoulders. Inhale and press your palms into the ground, lifting your chest and head off the mat. Hold for 30 seconds.
3. **Cat-Cow Pose (Marjaryasana-Bitilasana)**: Start on all fours. Inhale and arch your back, lifting your tailbone and head towards the ceiling (cat pose). Exhale and round your back, tucking your chin to your chest and your tailbone towards the ground (cow pose). Repeat for 30 seconds.
4. **Child's Pose (Balasana)**: Kneel on the mat and sit back onto your heels. Stretch your arms out in front of you and lower your forehead to the ground. Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute.

**Sequence 2: Seated Poses (10-15 minutes)**

1. **Seated Forward Fold (Paschimottanasana)**: Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you. Inhale and lengthen your spine. Exhale and fold forward, reaching for your toes or shins. Hold for 30 seconds to 1 minute.
2. **Seated Twist (Bharadvajasana)**: Sit on the ground with your legs crossed. Twist your torso to the right, bringing your right hand to your left knee. Hold for 30 seconds and then switch sides.
3. **Seated Leg Stretch (Akarna Dhanurasana)**: Sit on the ground with your legs extended in front of you. Lift your right leg out to the side, keeping your knee straight. Hold for 30 seconds and then switch legs.

**Final Relaxation (5-10 minutes)**

1. **Legs Up The Wall Pose (Viparita Karani)**: Lie on your back with your legs straight up against a wall. Relax your body and focus on your breath. Hold for 5-10 minutes.
2. **Savasana (Corpse Pose)**: Lie on your back with your arms and legs relaxed. Close your eyes and focus on your breath. Hold for 5-10 minutes.

**Tips and Modifications**

* Listen to your body and modify or come out of the pose if you experience any discomfort or pain.
* Use blocks, straps, or blankets to support your body in various poses.
* Start slow and gradually increase your practice time as you become more comfortable.
* Focus on your breath and try to maintain a steady, gentle flow.
* Practice yoga on a mat or a non-slip surface to prevent injuries.

Remember, yoga is a journey, and it's essential to be patient and kind to yourself as you begin. Start with this routine
